Articles.Content:
Ok, a question about orbital mechanics.

So, I'm just trying to get to Moho come hell or high water (infinite fuel cheat).

I've got the ascending node to 0,

I've got the separation closest approach down to 650,000 kilometers.

I'm at apogee.

What should be my strategy to close the deal?

there's gotta be some burn prograde/retrograde/normal/antinormal/radial/antiradial/target/antitarget/whatever

that can eat up those last 650,000 kilometers.

[http://s22.photobucket.com/user/planettom/media/KSP2015/moho-approach_zps8m8rpzw9.jpg.html](http://s22.photobucket.com/user/planettom/media/KSP2015/moho-approach_zps8m8rpzw9.jpg.html)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-21T06:25:08Z" title="06/21/2015 06:25  AM" data-short="9 yr">June 21, 2015</time> by Algomeysa**

Mess around with the manuever planner to see what gets you closer. Make only tiny adjustments. If you have matched planes with your target, then you dont need the normal and antinormal

The other option is to wait until you get closer, then plan out another manuever.

Burning radial got the job done. I'm on Moho!

[http://s22.photobucket.com/user/planettom/media/ksp/moho_zpsaolrsjep.jpg.html](http://s22.photobucket.com/user/planettom/media/ksp/moho_zpsaolrsjep.jpg.html)

The mysterious Mohole at Moho's North Pole:

[http://s22.photobucket.com/user/planettom/media/KSP2015/mohole_zpsrxnyresy.jpg.html](http://s22.photobucket.com/user/planettom/media/KSP2015/mohole_zpsrxnyresy.jpg.html)

At the bottom of the Mohole on Moho.

[http://s22.photobucket.com/user/planettom/media/KSP2015/mohole2_zpsornze9vg.jpg.html](http://s22.photobucket.com/user/planettom/media/KSP2015/mohole2_zpsornze9vg.jpg.html)

194 meters is as deep as I could go (nearly 5 kilometers deep).

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-21T18:53:17Z" title="06/21/2015 06:53  PM" data-short="9 yr">June 21, 2015</time> by Algomeysa**
